explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.findings: A blog post highlights the need for bias-free datasets and details a bias monitoring approach.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

relevant_sources.summary: This CBRE blog post provides evidence for fairness, governance, privacy, and transparency. It supports fairness by highlighting the need for bias-free datasets and detailing a bias monitoring approach. Governance is evidenced through mentions of AI use in decision-making and data analysis for facility planning, as well as vendor selection. The blog post also supports privacy by discussing privacy controls for AI, and transparency by explicitly stating AI assistance in content creation and its use in data analysis.
relevant_sources.title: AI's Impact on Healthcare Real Estate

governance.findings: Published materials highlight the importance of a governance framework for AI implementation and implicitly contribute to the understanding of AI governance through descriptions of AI platform enablement and underlying structure and deployment. The company details AI tools used for risk management and compliance monitoring, and references AI use in decision-making, data analysis for facility planning, and vendor selection. Challenges like data quality and expertise are mentioned as necessitating structured approaches to AI adoption and use, and the analytical power and expansion plans of platforms like Capital AI are detailed.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned help page, "Where AI Becomes Real - CBRE AI Strategy," provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The document supports transparency by discussing AI applications, use cases, and the capabilities of the Ellis AI platform, including GenAI and digital assistants, for employee use. Implicitly, the description of the AI platform's enablement also contributes to the understanding of AI governance.
relevant_sources.title: Where AI Becomes Real - CBRE AI Strategy

relevant_sources.summary: This CBRE insights blog post, "Effective Technology and AI," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. The article highlights the importance of a governance framework for AI implementation, specifically mentioning challenges like data quality and expertise, which necessitate oversight and structured approaches to AI adoption and use.
relevant_sources.title: Effective Technology and AI

relevant_sources.summary: This CBRE blog post on "The Role of AI in Workplace Technology" provides evidence for the **governance**, **oversight**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The article supports governance by detailing AI tools used for risk management and compliance monitoring. It also supports privacy and transparency by mentioning guidelines for data privacy and transparency in AI-driven processes, and emphasizes human oversight as central to decision-making.
relevant_sources.title: The Role of AI in Workplace Technology

relevant_sources.summary: This CBRE blog post provides evidence for fairness, governance, privacy, and transparency. relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "Everyone Can Have a Digital Assistant with Ellis AI," provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The article supports transparency by describing the AI platform's capabilities, its role in empowering professionals, and highlighting the use cases and benefits of GenAI. It also indicates transparency in AI system development and deployment through mentions of launching an MLOps platform and a GenAI platform, which implicitly points to governance in its underlying structure and deployment.
relevant_sources.title: Everyone Can Have a Digital Assistant with Ellis AI

relevant_sources.summary: This press release for CBRE's Capital AI platform provides evidence for **governance, privacy, and transparency**. It supports governance by detailing the AI's analytical power for decision-making and its expansion plans. Evidence for privacy is found in the mention of AI analysis of investor profiles and variables. Transparency is supported by the press release's description of the AI's capabilities in generating market insights, identifying capital sources, and predicting trends.
relevant_sources.title: CBRE Capital AI Press Release

oversight.findings: A blog post emphasizes human oversight as central to decision-making processes involving AI.
oversight.path_to_improvement: Publish override mechanisms, escalation processes, or appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This CBRE blog post on "The Role of AI in Workplace Technology" provides evidence for the **governance**, **oversight**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The article supports governance by detailing AI tools used for risk management and compliance monitoring. It also supports privacy and transparency by mentioning guidelines for data privacy and transparency in AI-driven processes, and emphasizes human oversight as central to decision-making.

privacy.findings: Published materials mention guidelines for data privacy in AI-driven processes and discuss privacy controls for AI. A press release also references AI analysis of investor profiles and variables.
privacy.path_to_improvement: Publish AI-specific privacy impact assessments or data handling procedures.

transparency.findings: The company provides transparency by describing AI applications, use cases, and capabilities of its Ellis AI platform, including GenAI and digital assistants, for employee use. Published materials also mention guidelines for transparency in AI-driven processes, state AI assistance in content creation and data analysis, and detail the methodology, operation, data sources, and analytical capabilities of AI systems like Capital AI and AI-enhanced transaction capture. Transparency in AI system development and deployment is indicated through mentions of launching MLOps and GenAI platforms.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

relevant_sources.summary: This press release, "CBRE Investment Management AI-Enhanced Data Collection," provides evidence for the **transparency** pillar of responsible AI. The document details the AI-enhanced methodology for transaction capture, explaining how the system scrapes news sources and public transactions to identify structures and aggregate real-time secondary deal information. This description of the AI system's operation, data sources, and analytical capabilities demonstrates transparency in its functionality and role within market analysis.
relevant_sources.title: CBRE Investment Management AI-Enhanced Data Collection

summary.overall_findings: CBRE's public disclosures address transparency through a company-owned help page that describes AI applications and capabilities of the Ellis AI platform for employee use. This is one of five responsible AI pillars with documented evidence, with fairness materials highlighting the need for bias-free datasets. Additionally, published materials discuss privacy controls for AI and emphasize human oversight as central to decision-making, indicating policy-level attention across these areas. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability or external accountability, based on a review of 13 publicly available sources.
